definition: to call at/to stop at/berth
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
port of call
bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover

sentences.english: The ship lies alongside the wharf.; The steamer lies at the pier.
If you feel drowsy while you are driving, you should pull over and rest a while.
sentences.chinese: 你若开车时很困，就应停靠路边休息一下。

sentences.english: I've meandered now from the downtown ferry terminal up to the Pike Place Public Market.
sentences.chinese: 我从渡船停靠的渡口一直漫步到派克公共市场。

sentences.english: It's on a barge docked at Staten Island , one of New York City's five boroughs.
sentences.chinese: 这对在史泰登岛，纽约市的五个区之一停靠一艘趸船。

sentences.english: It arrives at track No.3,so please wait there.
sentences.chinese: 它将停靠在第3道，请在那里等候。

sentences.english: Cab stations are located everywhere in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 出租车停靠点在市中心的任何角落都有设立。

sentences.english: Joseph idled the car at the curb.
sentences.chinese: 约瑟夫大大咧咧地把车停靠在路边。
与“方舟天使”号停靠在一起。

sentences.english: Her driver knew all the best places to pull over along Highway 101.
sentences.chinese: 她的司机知道101高速公路上所有的最佳停靠点。

sentences.english: The bus stop is near your factory.
sentences.chinese: 这巴士停靠点离你的工厂近。

sentences.english: A players ball is resting against the flagstick.
sentences.chinese: 一名球员的球停靠在了旗杆旁边。

sentences.english: The next stop is much further on.
sentences.chinese: 下一个停靠站离这里很远。

sentences.english: The Beagle's first stop was one of the Cape Verde Islands near the coast of Africa.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔格号第一站在非洲海岸附近的佛得角停靠。

sentences.english: Could you take my bags to the Taxi Stand, please?
sentences.chinese: 方便把我的行李放到出租车停靠站吗？

sentences.english: Above, ships sit in the Guantouling Bay.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，船只可以停靠冠头岭湾。

sentences.english: Only slow trains stop at that station.
sentences.chinese: 那个站只有慢车才有停靠。

definition: (of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
to anchor/anchorage/mooring (of a ship)
(of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover
to leave port/to put off
bound for
to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to ride (in a vehicle)
to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
bus stop
to pass through/via/by way of
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
(railway) train
to park (a car etc)/to moor (a boat etc)/to leave sth (in a place)
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
